text: This year's Golden Globe awards were all about the sexual misconduct claims currently plaguing Hollywood, but one actress took issue with various details surroundings Sunday night's ceremony, in particular James Franco's Best Actor win. Ally Sheedy, who starred in The Breakfast Club and St. Elmo's Fire, appeared to accuse the Golden Globes of hypocrisy for awarding Franco with Best Actor in a Musical - Comedy for The Disaster Artist. Taking to Twitter with a series of cryptic ( now deleted ) tweets, Sheedy questioned why the star of The Deuce was even allowed to attend the event. ` ` Why is a man hosting? Why is James Franco allowed in? Said too much. Nite love ya # goldenglobes,'' Sheedy wrote
